about_the_game:
"Kusodeka Bayashi" is a first-person horror comedy where the young protagonist, "Me," faces an eerie and terrifying experience while staying at his grandparents' countryside home.

Note: This game cannot be played in English. All languages in the game are Japanese.

Story

Me am sent to live with my grandfather in a quiet rural village while my mom prepares to give birth to my new sibling. Surrounded by the peaceful nature of "Sodehiki Town," I expect a calm, relaxing time.

───Or so it seemed...

Right from the moment I arrive, something feels off. Strange Jizo statues dot the town, and mysterious men clad in full leather break the idyllic countryside atmosphere. On top of that, the town’s deep-rooted worship of a cursed god seems to be disturbingly tied to my own family...

"Ugh, enough already! Curses, gods—this is too much!"

Can Me ever restore my quiet, carefree days in the countryside?

Contents

The game is an "action adventure" in which you explore the field from a first-person perspective.

The objective of the game is to solve the mystery based on clues hidden in the abandoned village and find out the whereabouts of his best friend Hikaru.

Playing time: about 30 minutes

Number of endings: 1
